analyzed: de la ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed rnams mngon par bsgrub po snyam du mi sems so //

original: rga shi yang 'di snyam du bdag ni skye bas mngon par bsgrub po snyam du mi sems pa'i bar du ste /üîΩ'on kyang ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub cing /

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nas /

analyzed: de ltar na nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'brel par blta'o //

analyzed: te ; khams drug po gang dag 'dus pa'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gang 'di 'dus nas lus kyi sra ba'i dngos po mngon par 'grub par byed pa 'di ni sa'i khams zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gang lus sdud pa'i bya ba byed pa 'di ni chu'i khams zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gang lus kyi dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i bya ba byed pa de ni rlung gi khams zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gang lus kyi nang sbubs yod par byed pa 'di ni nam mkha'i khams zhes bya'o //

translated: The consciousness element is that which performs the function of producing the sprout of name-and-form in the body, in the manner of a reed pierced by a straw, and it is the five collections of consciousness and the contaminated mental consciousness.

translated: then from the coming together of all of them, the body comes into being.üîΩThe earth element does not think, ‚ÄúI make the body‚Äôs solidity.‚ÄùüîΩThe water element does not think, ‚ÄúI collect the body.‚Äù

analyzed: sred pa 'phel ba ni len pa'o //

analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyang de bzhin no //

translated: The experience of those various feelings, the delight in them, the attachment to them, and the dwelling with that attachment is called the condition of feeling giving rise to craving.

translated: The experience, delight, attachment, and dwelling with attachment lead to the thought, ‚ÄúMay I not be separated from the pleasant and agreeable things that I experience!‚Äù This is called the condition of craving giving rise to grasping.

analyzed: de ltar don du gnyer ba nas yang srid pa skyed pa'i las lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kun nas slong ba de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: las de las skyes pa'i phung po rnams grub pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin 'dus ma byas ma yin /

analyzed: rgyu med pa ma yin rkyen med pa ma yin /

original: myong ba yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: myong ba yod pa ma yin /

analyzed: zad pa'i chos ma yin /

original: 'jig pa'i chos ma yin /

original: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin te /

analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa rgyun ma chad par rlung gi rgyun bzhin du rjes su zhugs mod kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang yan lag bzhi po 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de bsdu bar bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dan las dang rnam par shes pa'o //

translated: How could those phenomena that are empty of intrinsic nature be pure or disturbed?

original: gang la yang dang ba'am 'khrugs pa mi dmigs pa de dag ji ltar gzugs la lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la yang dang ba'am 'khrugs pa mi dmigs pa de dag ji ltar gzugs la lta bar 'gyur /
translated: How could those who do not observe purity or disturbance see form?

original: de ltar mig gi skye mched ni mig gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis shin tu stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar mig gi skye mched ni mig gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis shin tu stong ste /
translated: In that way, the eye sense-sphere is utterly empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye sense-sphere.

original: de ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Because it does not come or go, the prior limit is not observed, and the later limit is not observed.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de la gnas pa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de la gnas pa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Because it has no intrinsic nature, abiding in it is not observed.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis med pa de ni bud med kyang ma yin skyes pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis med pa de ni bud med kyang ma yin skyes pa yang ma yin no //
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature is neither a woman nor a man.

original: gang bud med kyang ma yin skyes pa yang ma yin pa de ni des rlom sems su lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang bud med kyang ma yin skyes pa yang ma yin pa de ni des rlom sems su lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which is neither female nor male be the object of conceit?

original: rgyal po chen po rlom sems ni bdud kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rlom sems ni bdud kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: Great King, conceit is the domain of MƒÅra.

original: rlom @139b sems med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rlom @139b sems med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The absence of conceit is the domain of the Buddha.

original: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni rlom sems dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rlom sems dang bral ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are free from conceit.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: rgyal po chen po de la rna ba'i skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de la rna ba'i skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar gang zhe na /
translated: Great King, what is the sense source of the ear, up to the sense source of the body?

original: gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang ba'o //
translated: It is the lucidity of the four great elements.

original: rgyal po chen po de ltar na chos thams cad kyi bar ni /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de ltar na chos thams cad kyi bar ni /
translated: Great King, in this way, all phenomena

original: rnam par thar pa la mngon par phyogs pa chos kyi dbyings su nges pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la mngon par phyogs pa chos kyi dbyings su nges pa /
translated: are directed toward liberation, are ascertained in the realm of phenomena,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas klas pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas klas pa /
translated: and extend to the end of space.

original: gdags su med pa /üîΩtha snyad med pa /üîΩbrjod du med pa /
analyzed: gdags su med pa / tha snyad med pa / brjod du med pa /
translated: They are beyond designation,üîΩbeyond convention,üîΩinexpressible,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: and beyond expression.

original: rgyal po chen po gang la dbang po rnams thogs par 'gyur ba de ni yul rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po gang la dbang po rnams thogs par 'gyur ba de ni yul rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Great King, that which is the object of the sense faculties is called the object.

original: mig gis gzugs rnams la thogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzugs rnams ni mig gi yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams la thogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzugs rnams ni mig gi yul zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the eye is obstructed by forms, forms are called the object of the eye.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i sgra rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i sgra rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the ear and sounds, etc.

original: de la mig gzugs rnams la thogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bab pa'i thogs par 'gyur bar bstan te /
analyzed: de la mig gzugs rnams la thogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bab pa'i thogs par 'gyur bar bstan te /
translated: Here, the statement ‚ÄúThe eye is obstructed by forms‚Äù teaches that it is obstructed by falling.

original: 'di ltar mig ni gzugs rnams la rnam par gsum du 'bab ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig ni gzugs rnams la rnam par gsum du 'bab ste /
translated: Thus, the eye falls upon forms in three ways:

original: mthun pa rnams la sdug pa'i 'du shes kyis 'bab pa dang / mi mthun pa rnams la khong khro ba'i 'du shes kyis 'bab pa dang / mthun pa yang ma yin mi mthun pa yang ma yin pa rnams la btang snyoms kyi 'du shes kyis 'bab pa //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams la sdug pa'i 'du shes kyis 'bab pa dang / mi mthun pa rnams la khong khro ba'i 'du shes kyis 'bab pa dang / mthun pa yang ma yin mi mthun pa yang ma yin pa rnams la btang snyoms kyi 'du shes kyis 'bab pa //
translated: it falls upon agreeable forms with the perception of beauty, it falls upon disagreeable forms with the perception of aversion, and it falls upon forms that are neither agreeable nor disagreeable with the perception of indifference.

original: de bzhin du yid ni chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid ni chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the mind falls upon phenomena, etc.

original: yul de dag ni yid kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yul de dag ni yid kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba ste /
translated: These objects are called the domain of mental activity.

original: de la yid spyod cing rnam par spyod pas de'i phyir yid kyi spyod yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yid spyod cing rnam par spyod pas de'i phyir yid kyi spyod yul zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the mind moves and operates on them, they are called the domain of mental activity.

original: rgyal po chen po yid de mthun pa'i gzugs rnams la rjes su chags par spyod pa des ni de'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po yid de mthun pa'i gzugs rnams la rjes su chags par spyod pa des ni de'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, when the mind is attached to agreeable forms, desire arises.

original: mi mthun pa'i gzugs rnams la khong khro bar spyod pa des ni de'i zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i gzugs rnams la khong khro bar spyod pa des ni de'i zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur /
translated: When it is averse to disagreeable forms, hatred arises.

original: mthun pa yang ma yin mi mthun pa yang ma yin pa rnams la rmongs par spyod bdes ni de'i gti mug skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthun pa yang ma yin mi mthun pa yang ma yin pa rnams la rmongs par spyod bdes ni de'i gti mug skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When it is confused about neither agreeable nor disagreeable forms, delusion arises.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams la yang chos rnam pa gsum gsum la dmigs pa myong bar 'gyur te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams la yang chos rnam pa gsum gsum la dmigs pa myong bar 'gyur te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, with regard to sounds, smells, tastes, and touchables, three kinds of experiences are observed, as before.

original: rgyal po chen po de la dbang po rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu yul rnams ni rmi lam lta bur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de la dbang po rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu yul rnams ni rmi lam lta bur shes par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, the senses are like a magician‚Äôs illusions, and objects are like dreams.

original: @140a * // rgyal po chen po 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig nyal ba'i rmi lam na yul gyi bzang mo dang lhan cig tu yongs su spyod par rmis la /
analyzed: @140a * // rgyal po chen po 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig nyal ba'i rmi lam na yul gyi bzang mo dang lhan cig tu yongs su spyod par rmis la /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, for example, suppose that a man, while sleeping and dreaming, would dream that he was enjoying himself with a beautiful woman of a certain country.

original: de nyal ba las sad nas bud med yul gyi bzang mo de rjes su dran par gyur na /
analyzed: de nyal ba las sad nas bud med yul gyi bzang mo de rjes su dran par gyur na /
translated: Then, after he had fallen asleep, he would wake up and remember that woman, the beautiful woman of a certain country.

original: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Great King, what do you think of this?

original: rmi lam na mthong ba'i yul gyi bzang mo de yod dam gsol pa /
analyzed: rmi lam na mthong ba'i yul gyi bzang mo de yod dam gsol pa /
translated: Is that beautiful woman of a certain country whom he saw in the dream real?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis se //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis se //
translated: ‚Äù He replied, ‚ÄúBlessed One, she is not.üîΩ‚Äù The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúGreat King, what do you think of this?

original: bka' stsal pa rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems skyes bu gang rmi lam na yul gyi bzang mo mthong ba'i bud med de dang lhan cig tu rtse ba dang dga' ba dang / mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can yin nam gsol pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems skyes bu gang rmi lam na yul gyi bzang mo mthong ba'i bud med de dang lhan cig tu rtse ba dang dga' ba dang / mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can yin nam gsol pa /
translated: Is that man of good family who gets excited and clings to that woman with whom he plays and enjoys himself in the dream wise?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
translated: ‚Äù He replied, ‚ÄúBlessed One, he is not.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das rmi lam ni mthong ba'i yul gyi bzang mo de ni shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rmi lam ni mthong ba'i yul gyi bzang mo de ni shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: Blessed One, the beautiful woman who was seen in the dream does not exist and cannot be apprehended at all.

original: de dang lhan cig tu yongs su spyod pa lta ga la mchis te gzhan du na gang de la zhen pa'i mi de ni shin tu phongs shing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu yongs su spyod pa lta ga la mchis te gzhan du na gang de la zhen pa'i mi de ni shin tu phongs shing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: How could there be any enjoyment with her? On the contrary, the person who is attached to her is destined for ruin and exhaustion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rgyal po chen po de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa yang mig gis gzugs mthong na yid bde bar 'gyur ba rnams la mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /üîΩde mngon par zhen nas rjes su chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa yang mig gis gzugs mthong na yid bde bar 'gyur ba rnams la mngon par zhen par 'gyur te / de mngon par zhen nas rjes su chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, in the same way, a foolish, untrained ordinary person sees forms with the eye that are sources of mental pleasure.üîΩThey become attached to them.

original: rjes su chags par gyur nas yongs su chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags par gyur nas yongs su chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become attached, they become desirous.

original: yongs su chags par gyur nas 'dod chags las byung ba'i lus kyis ni rnam pa gsum ngag gis ni rnam pa bzhi yid kyis ni rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: yongs su chags par gyur nas 'dod chags las byung ba'i lus kyis ni rnam pa gsum ngag gis ni rnam pa bzhi yid kyis ni rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: Having become attached, one creates with the body, which arises from desire, three types of actions, with speech four types, and with mind three types.

original: las mngon par 'du byas pa de yang thog ma nyid nas zad cing 'gags la bral zhing rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byas pa de yang thog ma nyid nas zad cing 'gags la bral zhing rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: That action that one has created will, from the very beginning, be exhausted and cease, be separated from, and change.

original: shar phyogs su brten te gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: shar phyogs su brten te gnas pa ma yin /
translated: It does not remain supported in the east.

original: lho phyogs dang nub phyogs dang byang phyogs dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams rnams su brten te gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: lho phyogs dang nub phyogs dang byang phyogs dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams rnams su brten te gnas pa ma yin /
translated: It does not remain supported in the south, west, north, above, below, or in the intermediate directions.

original: 'di na ma yin pha bi na ma yin par bar ma dor ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na ma yin pha bi na ma yin par bar ma dor ma yin te /
translated: It is not here, nor is it there, nor in between.

original: dus gzhan na 'chi ba'i dus dang tshod nye bar gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dus gzhan na 'chi ba'i dus dang tshod nye bar gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: At another time, when the time of death arrives,

original: srog gi dbang po 'gags te tshe yongs su zad cing de dang skal ba 'dra ba'i las rnams kyang zad nas rnam par shes pa tha ma @140b 'gags pa'i tshe /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po 'gags te tshe yongs su zad cing de dang skal ba 'dra ba'i las rnams kyang zad nas rnam par shes pa tha ma @140b 'gags pa'i tshe /
translated: the faculty of life will cease, and when life is exhausted and the karma that is of a similar type to that is exhausted, at the time when the final consciousness ceases,

original: 'di lta ste dper na nyal nyal ba las sad pa'i yul gyi bzang mo dang 'dra bar yid kyis dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na nyal nyal ba las sad pa'i yul gyi bzang mo dang 'dra bar yid kyis dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like a man who has just woken up from a dream and still thinks about the beautiful woman he dreamed about.

original: rgyal po chen po de la rnam par shes pa tha ma'i dbang dang las dmigs pa de dang rkyen gnyis kyis skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de la rnam par shes pa tha ma'i dbang dang las dmigs pa de dang rkyen gnyis kyis skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, the first moment of consciousness at rebirth occurs due to the power of the final moment of consciousness and the object that is focused on.

original: yang na ni sems can dmyal bar /
analyzed: yang na ni sems can dmyal bar /
translated: It may be in the hells,

original: yang na ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su /
analyzed: yang na ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su /
translated: or in the animal realm,

original: yang na ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten du /
analyzed: yang na ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten du /
translated: or in the world of the Lord of Death,

original: yang na ni lha ma yin gyi ris su /
analyzed: yang na ni lha ma yin gyi ris su /
translated: or in the realm of the demigods,

original: yang na ni mi'i nang du /
analyzed: yang na ni mi'i nang du /
translated: or among humans,

original: yang na ni lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na ni lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: or among the gods.

original: rnam par shes pa dang po skye ba'i char gtogs pa de /üîΩde 'gags ma thag tu bar ma chad par /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang po skye ba'i char gtogs pa de / de 'gags ma thag tu bar ma chad par /
translated: The first moment of consciousness at rebirth

original: gang la rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba mngon pa'i sems kyi rgyud skal ba 'dra bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang la rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba mngon pa'i sems kyi rgyud skal ba 'dra bar 'byung ngo //
translated: immediately ceases and is followed by a continuum of consciousness that is similar in type and experiences the results of karma.

original: de la gang rnam par shes pa tha ma 'gag pa de ni 'chi 'pho zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang rnam par shes pa tha ma 'gag pa de ni 'chi 'pho zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, the cessation of the final moment of consciousness is what we call death.

original: gang rnam par shes pa dang po 'byung ba de la ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa dang po 'byung ba de la ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the first moment of consciousness is what we call birth.

original: rgyal po chen po de lta na chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba'ang med la 'chi 'pho dang skye bar mngon pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de lta na chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba'ang med la 'chi 'pho dang skye bar mngon pa'ang yod de /
translated: Great King, in this way, no phenomenon whatsoever passes from this world to the next, and yet birth and death are evident.

original: rgyal po chen po rnam par shes pa tha ma de skye ba'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rnam par shes pa tha ma de skye ba'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong //
translated: Great King, when the final moment of consciousness arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa'i tsho gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tsho gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: las kyang skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: las kyang skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: When karma arises, it does not come from anywhere. When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: rnam par shes pa dang po skye ba'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang po skye ba'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: When the first moment of consciousness arises, it does not come from anywhere. When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it has no intrinsic reality.

original: rnam par shes pa tha ma ni rnam par shes pa tha mas stong /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tha ma ni rnam par shes pa tha mas stong /
translated: The final consciousness is empty of the final consciousness.

original: las ni las kyis stong /
analyzed: las ni las kyis stong /
translated: Karma is empty of karma.

original: rnam par shes pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa dang pos stong /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa dang pos stong /
translated: The first moment of consciousness is empty of the first moment of consciousness.

original: 'chi 'pho ni 'chi 'phos stong /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ni 'chi 'phos stong /
translated: Death and transmigration are empty of death and transmigration.

original: skye ba ni skye bas stong la /
analyzed: skye ba ni skye bas stong la /

original: las rnams 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur zhing rnam par smin pa myong bar mngon pa yang yod de /
analyzed: las rnams 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur zhing rnam par smin pa myong bar mngon pa yang yod de /
translated: Karma does not become nonexistent, and the experience of ripening is evident.

analyzed: de la ming gi brda tsam ma gtogs par byed pa po'am za ba po gang yang med do //
translated: Apart from mere nominal designation, there is no agent or experiencer.

original: rgyal po chen po 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, it is like this:

original: mi zhig nyal ba'i rmi lam na dgra dang 'thab pa zhig rmis la /
analyzed: mi zhig nyal ba'i rmi lam na dgra dang 'thab pa zhig rmis la /
translated: For example, a man who is sleeping dreams that he fights with an enemy.

original: nyal ba las sad nas de nyid dran par gyur na /
analyzed: nyal ba las sad nas de nyid dran par gyur na /
translated: When he wakes up from his sleep, he remembers that.

original: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du @141a * //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du @141a * //
translated: Great King, what do you think?

analyzed: sems rmi lam du rmis pa'i dgra de'am dgra de dang 'thab pa yod dam / gsel  ba bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
translated: Is the enemy in the dream, or the fighting with that enemy, real?üîΩ‚Äù The king said, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, it is not.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: ‚Äù The Blessed One said:üîΩ‚ÄúGreat King, what do you think?

original: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems 'o na skyes bu gang rmi lam gyi dgra la mngon par zhen pa'am /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems 'o na skyes bu gang rmi lam gyi dgra la mngon par zhen pa'am /
translated: Great King, what do you think of this?üîΩ

original: dgra dang 'thab par 'gyur ba de mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can yin nam /
analyzed: dgra dang 'thab par 'gyur ba de mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can yin nam /
translated: Great King, what do you think of this? Is the person who is attached to the enemy in a dream, or who fights with the enemy, someone who has the nature of being wise?

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
translated: He replied, Bhagavan, that is not so.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bdag nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bur byas te /

analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos par bya / gzhan la skabs phye zhing sems can la go cha dor bar mi bya /

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thad du sems can bskyab pa'i brtson pa las ldog par mi bya /

analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad bsal ba'i yongs su bsngo ba las ldog par mi bya /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu yongs su bzung bar mi bya /

analyzed: zhes bskal pa grang pas byang chub mi tshol gyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go cha gyon par byed do //

analyzed: lo bgrang ba 'dis lo 'bum la byang chub kyi sems gcig bskyed cing /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gcig mthong la / 'jug pa @156a * //

original: 'di dang bgrang ba 'dis gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems bskyed pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas sems can gcig gi sems dang spyod pa shes par gyur la /

original: 'jug pa 'di dang bgrangs pa 'dis de snyed kyi sems bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa rnams shes par gyur kyang /

original: mi zhum pa'i go cha 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha mi zad pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi zhum pa'i go cha 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha mi zad pa zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams la yang sbyar ro //

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /

analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can dmu rgod sems can gdul dka' bar rig ste /

analyzed: gang na sems can 'di lta bu dag gi ming yang mi thos pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag par smon lam ni 'debs so //

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa 'di las bsnyigs pa sangs rgyas thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis spang bar gyur pa yod pa de dag bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dus par gyur la /

original: bdag gis de dag byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug tu bcug ste /
analyzed: bdag gis de dag byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug tu bcug ste /
translated: May I cause them to sit on the seat of enlightenment

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed de /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sems pa'i sems bskyed pa re re la yang bdud kyi gnas thams cad rab tu g-yo'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyang de'i bsngags pa gsung par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //

original: de ltar @156b re zhig bsod nams mngon par spel bar 'dod pas brtson pa brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar @156b re zhig bsod nams mngon par spel bar 'dod pas brtson pa brtan par bya'o //

original: da ni bsam pa brtan par bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bsam pa brtan par bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, one should speak of the firmness of thought.

original: brtan par bya ba 'dis ci bya snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brtan par bya ba 'dis ci bya snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the doubt, ‚ÄúWhat is the use of this firmness? ‚Äù

original: 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: , it is said in the noble Dharmasangiti-sutra:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni chos rnams kyi rtsa ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavat, a firm resolve is the root of all dharmas.

analyzed: gang la bsam pa ma mchis pa de la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ring ba lags so //
translated: He who has no resolve has all the dharmas of the Buddha far away from him.

original: bcom ldan 'das bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la ni /

original: gal te sangs rgyas mi bzhugs na yang nam mkha'i dkyil dang rtsig pa dang shing rnams las chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas mi bzhugs na yang nam mkha'i dkyil dang rtsig pa dang shing rnams las chos 'byung ngo //
translated: Even if the Buddhas are absent, the Dharma comes forth from the sky, from the walls, and from the trees.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa dag pa la ni rang gi yid kyi spyod pa nyid las gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa 'byung ngo //
translated: For the Bodhisattva whose thoughts are pure, advice and instruction come forth from his own mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bas na byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa phun sum tshogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bas na byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa phun sum tshogs par bgyi'o //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, the Bodhisattva should be perfect in thought.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is as follows:

analyzed: dper na gang la rkang pa mchis pa de la 'gro ba mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, wherever there are feet, there is walking.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du gang la bsam pa mchis pa de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mchis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du gang la bsam pa mchis pa de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, wherever there is thought, there are the qualities of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, it is as follows:

original: yan lag gi dam pa mgo gang la mchis pa de la 'tsho ba mchis so //
analyzed: yan lag gi dam pa mgo gang la mchis pa de la 'tsho ba mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, wherever there is a head, the most important of all the limbs, there is life.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bsam pa gang la mchis pa de la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mchis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bsam pa gang la mchis pa de la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, wherever there is thought, there is the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper na gang la 'tsho ba mchis pa de la rnyed pa mchis so //
analyzed: dper na gang la 'tsho ba mchis pa de la rnyed pa mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, wherever there is life, there is wealth.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du gang la bsam pa mchis pa de la sangs rgyas kyi rnyed pa mchis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du gang la bsam pa mchis pa de la sangs rgyas kyi rnyed pa mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, wherever there is intention, there is the wealth of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper na zhugs shing mchis na zhugs 'bar gyi zhugs shing ma mchis na zhugs mi 'bar ro //
analyzed: dper na zhugs shing mchis na zhugs 'bar gyi zhugs shing ma mchis na zhugs mi 'bar ro //
translated: Blessed One, wherever there is fuel, there is fire; wherever there is no fuel, there is no fire.

translated: Blessed One, in the same way, in the bodhisattva who has intention, the qualities of the Buddha blaze; in the one without intention, they do not blaze.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper na sprin chags na char 'bab kyi sprin ma chags na char mi 'bab po //
analyzed: dper na sprin chags na char 'bab kyi sprin ma chags na char mi 'bab po //
translated: Blessed One, wherever there are clouds, there is rain; wherever there are no clouds, there is no rain.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bsam pa ma mchis na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'byung gi bsam pa mchis na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, wherever there is no intention, there are the qualities of the Buddha; wherever there is intention, there are not.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper na zhugs shing @157a * //
analyzed: dper na zhugs shing @157a * //
translated: For example,

analyzed: gang rtsa ba nyams pa de las me tog dang 'bras bu rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: when the root of a tree is damaged, flowers and fruits do not grow.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du gang bsam pa log par zhugs pa de las dge ba'i chos thams cad mi 'byung ngo //

translated: Blessed One, therefore, a bodhisattva who seeks the enlightenment of a Buddha should hold his own intention very dear, protect it, and purify it.

original: bsam pa zhes bya ba 'di ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa zhes bya ba 'di ji lta bu zhe na /
